EMPANADA: Any of a variety of stuffed pastries found in Spanish and Latin American cuisine.
GYOZA: A 5-letter word related to channel surfing.
PIEROGI: A square- or crescent-shaped dumpling of unleavened dough, stuffed with sauerkraut, cheese, mashed potatoes, cabbage, onion, meat, or any combination of these, or with a fruit filling.
RAVIOLI: Small square parcels of pasta filled with meat, cheese, spinach etc.
SAMOSA: A snack, of Indian origin, consisting of a deep-fried triangular turnover filled with vegetables (especially potatoes) or meat.
WONTON: A Chinese dumpling, often stuffed with varieties of meat or seafood and vegetables.
